title: Teaching
text:
About me
I hold a Master‚Äôs degree from India and a PhD from the University of British Columbia. My research background is in Chemical Biology. I currently teach undergraduate courses and enjoy combining active learning with clear, well-structured assessments. Outside of teaching I love spending time outdoors, exploring new places, and trying different types of food.


Teaching appointments

Lecturer, Department of Microbiology & Immunology, University of British Columbia (UBC) ‚Äî Lecturer Dates: add dates
Instructor, Department of [Department name], University of Manitoba ‚Äî Instructor Dates: add dates
Other teaching roles (guest lectures, TA, workshop instructor)
Guest lectures and workshop facilitation ‚Äî add details and dates



Courses taught

SCIE 133 ‚Äî [Course title / short description] Role: Instructor / Lecturer / Guest (choose one). Semester: add semester(s) Short description: Introduce the course in one or two lines (e.g., course level, topics covered, typical class size).
MICB 323 ‚Äî [Course title / short description] Role: Instructor / Lecturer / Guest (choose one). Semester: add semester(s) Short description: Key topics and learning objectives.
MICB 212 ‚Äî [Course title / short description] Role: Instructor / Lecturer / Guest (choose one). Semester: add semester(s) Short description: Key topics and learning objectives.



Supervision & Mentorship

Undergraduate project supervision ‚Äî list student names, project titles, dates
Graduate student mentorship ‚Äî list names and roles
Lab training and mentoring for new TAs ‚Äî add details



Teaching materials & resources

Slides, assessments, and lab resources ‚Äî link or point to repository (e.g., Teams, Canvas, GitHub, or OneDrive).
Example: ‚ÄúSlides for MICB 323 ‚Äî link or path‚Äù



Teaching philosophy (short)
I focus on clarity, inclusivity, and active learning. I use a mixture of formative assessments and in-class activities to build student confidence and competence. I aim to create an engaging learning environment where students feel supported to explore, ask questions, and practice scientific thinking.

title: Sreeparna Vappala
text: I am a science educator and biologist passionate about making science accessible and engaging for everyone. My interests span science communication, molecular immunology, and cell biology. In my teaching, I strive to create inclusive, dynamic learning environments grounded in evidence-based practices. Outside of work, I enjoy hiking, traveling, and discovering great coffee spots.
